verses.text: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

similars.text: Look upon mine affliction and my pain; and forgive all my sins.
He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.
Thus saith the Lord, In this thou shalt know that I am the Lord: behold, I will smite with the rod that is in mine hand upon the waters which are in the river, and they shall be turned to blood.
He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.
Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the Lord of hosts.
I, the Lord, have suffered the affliction to come upon them, wherewith they have been afflicted, in consequence of their transgressions;

verses.text: He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.

similars.text: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.
I am the light which shineth in darkness, and the darkness comprehendeth it not.
When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;
He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.
He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.
He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.

verses.text: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.

similars.text: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.
Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

verses.text: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

similars.text: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews.
My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.
My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.
Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews.
By reason of the voice of my groaning my bones cleave to my skin.
My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.

verses.text: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.

similars.text: His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.
He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.
His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.
Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,
He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.

verses.text: He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.

similars.text: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.
For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.
Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.
He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.
He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.

verses.text: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.

similars.text: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.
He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.

verses.text: Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.

similars.text: Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.
Hear my prayer, O Lord, and let my cry come unto thee.
Hear, O Lord, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.
In my distress I cried unto the Lord, and he heard me.

verses.text: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.

similars.text: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.
He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.
He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.
He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.

verses.text: He was unto me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.

similars.text: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.

verses.text: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.

similars.text: But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.
From above hath he sent fire into my bones, and it prevaileth against them: he hath spread a net for my feet, he hath turned me back: he hath made me desolate and faint all the day.
He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.
He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.
But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.
He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.
From above hath he sent fire into my bones, and it prevaileth against them: he hath spread a net for my feet, he hath turned me back: he hath made me desolate and faint all the day.
I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.
He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.
He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.
He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.

verses.text: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

similars.text: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.
And I will shoot three arrows on the side thereof, as though I shot at a mark.
If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.
I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.
For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand presseth me sore.
And he hath made my mouth like a sharp sword; in the shadow of his hand hath he hid me, and made me a polished shaft; in his quiver hath he hid me;
And he hath made my mouth like a sharp sword; in the shadow of his hand hath he hid me, and made me a polished shaft; in his quiver hath he hid me;

verses.text: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.

verses.text: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.
He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.
He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.

similars.text: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.

verses.text: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.

similars.text: Behold, for peace I had great bitterness: but thou hast in love to my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption: for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back.
My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.

verses.text: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the Lord:

similars.text: And I besought the Lord at that time, saying,

verses.text: Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.
My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.

similars.text: Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they are the rejoicing of my heart.
My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.
My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.

verses.text: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.
It is of the Lord's mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

similars.text: Nevertheless for thy great mercies' sake thou didst not utterly consume them, nor forsake them; for thou art a gracious and merciful God.
The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.
The Lord is gracious, and full of compassion; slow to anger, and of great mercy.
The just Lord is in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not; but the unjust knoweth no shame.

verses.text: They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.

similars.text: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night,

verses.text: The Lord is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

similars.text: I wait for the Lord, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
My soul fainteth for thy salvation: but I hope in thy word.
My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the Lord.
My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
Bless the Lord, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.
Now behold, this giveth my soul sorrow; nevertheless, my soul hath joy in my son, because of that part of his seed which shall be taken unto God.
And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
Behold, God is mine helper: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.
Blessed is the man that trusteth in the Lord, and whose hope the Lord is.
Behold my servant, whom I have chosen; my beloved, in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my spirit upon him, and he shall shew judgment to the Gentiles.
While I live will I praise the Lord: I will sing praises unto my God while I have any being.
Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.
Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
Behold my servant, whom I uphold; mine elect, in whom my soul delighteth; I have put my spirit upon him: he shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.
With my soul have I desired thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me will I seek thee early: for when thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.
I will say of the Lord, He is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust.
I wait for the Lord, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.
The Lord is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.
I cried unto thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.
My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee.
For thou art my hope, O Lord God: thou art my trust from my youth.

verses.text: The Lord is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.

similars.text: I wait for the Lord, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.

And therefore will the Lord wait, that he may be gracious unto you, and therefore will he be exalted, that he may have mercy upon you: for the Lord is a God of judgment: blessed are all they that wait for him.
Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.
Our soul waiteth for the Lord: he is our help and our shield.
Wait on the Lord: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the Lord.
It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the Lord.
That they should seek the Lord, if haply they might feel after him, and find him, though he be not far from every one of us:
Therefore I will look unto the Lord; I will wait for the God of my salvation: my God will hear me.
My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
Seek ye the Lord while he may be found, call ye upon him while he is near:
My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.
For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.
And it shall be said in that day, Lo, this is our God; we have waited for him, and he will save us: this is the Lord; we have waited for him, we will be glad and rejoice in his salvation.
Do good, O Lord, unto those that be good, and to them that are upright in their hearts.
I wait for the Lord, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
The Lord taketh pleasure in them that fear him, in those that hope in his mercy.

verses.text: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the Lord.

verses.text: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.
He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.
He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.
He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.
For the Lord will not cast off for ever:

similars.text: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?
For the Lord will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.
The Lord shall reign for ever and ever.
Surely he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.
For she shall not be removed out of her place. I, the Lord, have spoken it. Amen.
Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
For the Lord will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.
The Lord shall reign for ever and ever.
The Lord will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.
For the Lord will not forsake his people for his great name's sake: because it hath pleased the Lord to make you his people.
Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?
For the Lord is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endureth to all generations.

verses.text: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.
For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.

similars.text: The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, neither shall the children be put to death for the fathers: every man shall be put to death for his own sin.
Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious at the wicked;

Also, thou son of man, shall it not be in the day when I take from them their strength, the joy of their glory, the desire of their eyes, and that whereupon they set their minds, their sons and their daughters,
Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.

Therefore the Lord shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall have mercy on their fatherless and widows; for every one of them is a hypocrite and an evildoer, and every mouth speaketh folly. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
For it is written, Rejoice, thou barren that bearest not; break forth and cry, thou that travailest not: for the desolate hath many more children than she which hath an husband.

Therefore the Lord shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall have mercy on their fatherless and widows: for every one is an hypocrite and an evildoer, and every mouth speaketh folly. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
Neither shall men tear themselves for them in mourning, to comfort them for the dead; neither shall men give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.
Brethren, be not children in understanding: howbeit in malice be ye children, but in understanding be men.
For the time soon cometh that the fulness of the wrath of God shall be poured out upon all the children of men; for he will not suffer that the wicked shall destroy the righteous.

But he slew not their children, but did as it is written in the law in the book of Moses, where the Lord commanded, saying, The fathers shall not die for the children, neither shall the children die for the fathers, but every man shall die for his own sin.
The sorrows of a travailing woman shall come upon him: he is an unwise son; for he should not stay long in the place of the breaking forth of children.
O Lord, we delight not in the destruction of our fellow men; their souls are precious before thee;
The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

verses.text: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,

similars.text: For he must reign, till he hath put all enemies under his feet.
And thus he goeth up and down, to and fro in the earth, seeking to destroy the souls of men.

verses.text: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,
To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.

similars.text: Saying, This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.
The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the Lord.
A good man obtaineth favour of the Lord: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.

But whatsoever thing persuadeth men to do evil, and believe not in Christ, and deny him, and serve not God, then ye may know with a perfect knowledge it is of the devil; for after this manner doth the devil work, for he persuadeth no man to do good, no, not one; neither do his angels; neither do they who subject themselves unto him.
Blessed is that man that maketh the Lord his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
Grant not, O Lord, the desires of the wicked: further not his wicked device; lest they exalt themselves. Selah.
This persuasion cometh not of him that calleth you.
Thou shalt not wrest the judgment of thy poor in his cause.

And again, the Lord God hath commanded that men should not murder; that they should not lie; that they should not steal; that they should not take the name of the Lord their God in vain; that they should not envy; that they should not have malice; that they should not contend one with another; that they should not commit whoredoms; and that they should do none of these things; for whoso doeth them shall perish.
A man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.

Hath he commanded any that they should not partake of his salvation? Behold I say unto you, Nay; but he hath given it free for all men; and he hath commanded his people that they should persuade all men to repentance.
Behold, hath the Lord commanded any that they should not partake of his goodness? Behold I say unto you, Nay; but all men are privileged the one like unto the other, and none are forbidden.

verses.text: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?

similars.text: Thus saith the Lord God, It shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass.
Thus saith the Lord God: It shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass.

When a prophet speaketh in the name of the Lord, if the thing follow not, nor come to pass, that is the thing which the Lord hath not spoken, but the prophet hath spoken it presumptuously: thou shalt not be afraid of him.

But it shall come to pass, if thou wilt not hearken unto the voice of the Lord thy God, to observe to do all his commandments and his statutes which I command thee this day; that all these curses shall come upon thee, and overtake thee:

Therefore it shall come to pass that whosoever will not believe in my words, who am Jesus Christ, which the Father shall cause him to bring forth unto the Gentiles, and shall give unto him power that he shall bring them forth unto the Gentiles, (it shall be done even as Moses said) they shall be cut off from among my people who are of the covenant.
And it shall come to pass, when the Lord shall have done to my lord according to all the good that he hath spoken concerning thee, and shall have appointed thee ruler over Israel;
For he knoweth not that which shall be: for who can tell him when it shall be?
Wherefore it shall come to pass, that the Lord God will deliver again the book and the words thereof to him that is not learned; and the man that is not learned shall say: I am not learned.

I the Lord have spoken it: it shall come to pass, and I will do it; I will not go back, neither will I spare, neither will I repent; according to thy ways, and according to thy doings, shall they judge thee, saith the Lord God.
And it shall come to pass, that whosoever will not hearken unto my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.
Wherefore be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is.
Behold, he taketh away, who can hinder him? who will say unto him, What doest thou?

And this is what our father meaneth; and he meaneth that it will not come to pass until after they are scattered by the Gentiles; and he meaneth that it shall come by way of the Gentiles, that the Lord may show his power unto the Gentiles, for the very cause that he shall be rejected of the Jews, or of the house of Israel.
The Lord repented for this: It shall not be, saith the Lord.
And when these things come, bringeth to pass the scripture which saith, there are they who were first, who shall be last; and there are they who were last, who shall be first.

And it shall come to pass, that when any shall yet prophesy, then his father and his mother that begat him shall say unto him, Thou shalt not live; for thou speakest lies in the name of the Lord: and his father and his mother that begat him shall thrust him through when he prophesieth.

And it shall come to pass, as soon as I am gone from thee, that the Spirit of the Lord shall carry thee whither I know not; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and he cannot find thee, he shall slay me: but I thy servant fear the Lord from my youth.

verses.text: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?
Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the Lord.

similars.text: Seek the Lord, and his strength: seek his face evermore.
Turn thou us unto thee, O Lord, and we shall be turned; renew our days as of old.

verses.text: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.

similars.text: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the Lord.
Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.
Unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
Unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.
The Lord lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.
Lift up your hearts and be glad, for I am in your midst, and am your advocate with the Father; and it is his good will to give you the kingdom.
Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.
My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.
For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
Arise, O Lord; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.
For I lift up my hand to heaven, and say, I live for ever.
And that all their salutations may be in the name of the Lord, with holy hands, uplifted to the Most High;
Lift up your hearts and rejoice, for unto you the kingdom, or in other words, the keys of the church have been given. Even so. Amen.
Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee, when I lift up my hands toward thy holy oracle.
Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the Lord.

verses.text: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.

similars.text: To the Lord our God belong mercies and forgivenesses, though we have rebelled against him;
We have sinned, and have committed iniquity, and have done wickedly, and have rebelled, even by departing from thy precepts and from thy judgments:
Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.
We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.
To the Lord our God belong mercies and forgivenesses, though we have rebelled against him;
We have dealt very corruptly against thee, and have not kept the commandments, nor the statutes, nor the judgments, which thou commandedst thy servant Moses.

verses.text: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.

similars.text: Thou hast taken away all thy wrath: thou hast turned thyself from the fierceness of thine anger.

Yea, and thou hast also heard me when I have been cast out and have been despised by mine enemies; yea, thou didst hear my cries, and wast angry with mine enemies, and thou didst visit them in thine anger with speedy destruction.
Thou hast called as in a solemn day my terrors round about, so that in the day of the Lord's anger none escaped nor remained: those that I have swaddled and brought up hath mine enemy consumed.
But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.
Persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;
And cover not their iniquity, and let not their sin be blotted out from before thee: for they have provoked thee to anger before the builders.

Behold, O Lord, thou hast smitten us because of our iniquity, and hast driven us forth, and for these many years we have been in the wilderness; nevertheless, thou hast been merciful unto us. O Lord, look upon me in pity, and turn away thine anger from this thy people, and suffer not that they shall go forth across this raging deep in darkness; but behold these things which I have molten out of the rock.
For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and howl: for the fierce anger of the Lord is not turned back from us.
But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.
Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.
But hast done evil above all that were before thee: for thou hast gone and made thee other gods, and molten images, to provoke me to anger, and hast cast me behind thy back:
O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.
We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.
But thou hast utterly rejected us; thou art very wroth against us.

verses.text: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.

similars.text: With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt.
Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

verses.text: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.

similars.text: Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.

verses.text: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.

similars.text: All thine enemies have opened their mouth against thee: they hiss and gnash the teeth: they say, We have swallowed her up: certainly this is the day that we looked for; we have found, we have seen it.

All thine enemies have opened their mouth against thee: they hiss and gnash the teeth: they say, We have swallowed her up: certainly this is the day that we looked for; we have found, we have seen it.

verses.text: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.

similars.text: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.
Fear, and the pit, and the snare, are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth.
Fear, and the pit, and the snare, are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth.
When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.

verses.text: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

similars.text: Oh that my head were waters, and mine eyes a fountain of tears, that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!
The hands of the pitiful women have sodden their own children: they were their meat in the destruction of the daughter of my people.

Mine eyes do fail with tears, my bowels are troubled, my liver is poured upon the earth, for the destruction of the daughter of my people; because the children and the sucklings swoon in the streets of the city.
For these things I weep; mine eye, mine eye runneth down with water, because the comforter that should relieve my soul is far from me: my children are desolate, because the enemy prevailed.
Oh that my head were waters, and mine eyes a fountain of tears, that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!
Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.

Therefore thou shalt say this word unto them; Let mine eyes run down with tears night and day, and let them not cease: for the virgin daughter of my people is broken with a great breach, with a very grievous blow.

verses.text: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,
Till the Lord look down, and behold from heaven.

similars.text: For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven did the Lord behold the earth;
For he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;
Truth shall spring out of the earth; and righteousness shall look down from heaven.
Who humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven, and in the earth!
And he saith unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Hereafter ye shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.
The Lord looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the sons of men.
And looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened.
Behold, the heaven and the heaven of heavens is the Lord's thy God, the earth also, with all that therein is.
Therefore I will look unto the Lord; I will wait for the God of my salvation: my God will hear me.
The Lord looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the sons of men.
For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven did the Lord behold the earth;
The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, and seek God.
For, behold, the Lord cometh forth out of his place, and will come down, and tread upon the high places of the earth.
The Lord is in his holy temple, the Lord's throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.

verses.text: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.

similars.text: Mine eyes do fail with tears, my bowels are troubled, my liver is poured upon the earth, for the destruction of the daughter of my people; because the children and the sucklings swoon in the streets of the city.

verses.text: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.
They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.
Waters flowed over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.
I called upon thy name, O Lord, out of the low dungeon.

similars.text: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Lord.
Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Lord.
Then called I upon the name of the Lord; O Lord, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.

verses.text: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

similars.text: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but there is no judgment.
I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.
O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.
Hear the right, O Lord, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.
Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.
For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,

verses.text: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.

similars.text: But I will deliver thee in that day, saith the Lord: and thou shalt not be given into the hand of the men of whom thou art afraid.
But be not thou far from me, O Lord: O my strength, haste thee to help me.
In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: and to Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.
Abide thou with me, fear not: for he that seeketh my life seeketh thy life: but with me thou shalt be in safeguard.
And shall say unto them, Hear, O Israel, ye approach this day unto battle against your enemies: let not your hearts faint, fear not, and do not tremble, neither be ye terrified because of them;
I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou contendest with me.
Thou hast called as in a solemn day my terrors round about, so that in the day of the Lord's anger none escaped nor remained: those that I have swaddled and brought up hath mine enemy consumed.
Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the Lord thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest.
In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.
And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.
Be not a terror unto me: thou art my hope in the day of evil.
O God, be not far from me: O my God, make haste for my help.
And the Lord, he it is that doth go before thee; he will be with thee, he will not fail thee, neither forsake thee: fear not, neither be dismayed.
Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.
And, behold, I will lay bands upon thee, and thou shalt not turn thee from one side to another, till thou hast ended the days of thy siege.
Forsake me not, O Lord: O my God, be not far from me.
In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.

verses.text: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

similars.text: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O Lord God of truth.
I said, Lord, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.
My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.
For great is thy mercy toward me: and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest hell.
O Lord, wilt thou redeem my soul? Wilt thou deliver me out of the hands of mine enemies? Wilt thou make me that I may shake at the appearance of sin?
I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;
O Lord, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.
I have waited for thy salvation, O Lord.
Behold, for peace I had great bitterness: but thou hast in love to my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption: for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back.
O Lord my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
Lord, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.
Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me; for I am desolate and afflicted.
I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions, and, as a cloud, thy sins: return unto me; for I have redeemed thee.
My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O Lord, how long?
Arise, O Lord; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.
And the king sware, and said, As the Lord liveth, that hath redeemed my soul out of all distress,
For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
O Lord, by these things men live, and in all these things is the life of my spirit: so wilt thou recover me, and make me to live.
O Lord my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
For great is thy mercy toward me: and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest hell.
Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O Lord God of truth.
O Lord, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
I cried unto thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.
Return, O Lord, deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies' sake.
But behold, the Lord hath redeemed my soul from hell; I have beheld his glory, and I am encircled about eternally in the arms of his love.
O Lord God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee:
I have longed for thy salvation, O Lord; and thy law is my delight.
Unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
I said, Lord, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.
And the king sware, and said, As the Lord liveth, that hath redeemed my soul out of all distress,
Lord, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.
Then called I upon the name of the Lord; O Lord, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.
I have waited for thy salvation, O Lord.
O Lord, thou hast searched me, and known me.
I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;
My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.
O Lord, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.

verses.text: O Lord, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.

similars.text: Wherefore I have not sinned against thee, but thou doest me wrong to war against me: the Lord the Judge be judge this day between the children of Israel and the children of Ammon.
Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned: behold, the judge standeth before the door.
But, O Lord of hosts, that judgest righteously, that triest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I revealed my cause.
Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.
The Lord therefore be judge, and judge between me and thee, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of thine hand.
I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.
Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation: O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.
The Lord judge between me and thee, and the Lord avenge me of thee: but mine hand shall not be upon thee.
For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.
And the Lord said, Hear what the unjust judge saith.
But, O Lord of hosts, that judgest righteously, that triest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I revealed my cause.
I know, O Lord, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.
The Lord therefore be judge, and judge between me and thee, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of thine hand.
For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.
But, O Lord of hosts, that triest the righteous, and seest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I opened my cause.
O Lord, correct me, but with judgment; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.
O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

verses.text: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.

similars.text: Thou hast heard their reproach, O Lord, and all their imaginations against me;
But hast done evil above all that were before thee: for thou hast gone and made thee other gods, and molten images, to provoke me to anger, and hast cast me behind thy back:

Yea, and thou hast also heard me when I have been cast out and have been despised by mine enemies; yea, thou didst hear my cries, and wast angry with mine enemies, and thou didst visit them in thine anger with speedy destruction.
Thou hast heard their reproach, O Lord, and all their imaginations against me;

verses.text: Thou hast heard their reproach, O Lord, and all their imaginations against me;

similars.text: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.

Yea, and thou hast also heard me when I have been cast out and have been despised by mine enemies; yea, thou didst hear my cries, and wast angry with mine enemies, and thou didst visit them in thine anger with speedy destruction.
Yet ye have not hearkened unto me, saith the Lord; that ye might provoke me to anger with the works of your hands to your own hurt.
Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.
Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people, even the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not hearkened unto my words, nor to my law, but rejected it.
Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me; thou hast made me an abomination unto them: I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.
They say still unto them that despise me, The Lord hath said, Ye shall have peace; and they say unto every one that walketh after the imagination of his own heart, No evil shall come upon you.
Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.
Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.
Thus with your mouth ye have boasted against me, and have multiplied your words against me: I have heard them.
Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.
Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;
Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O Lord, and that the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.
Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O Lord; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.

verses.text: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

similars.text: Mine enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are mad against me are sworn against me.
They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.
For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
Mine enemies would daily swallow me up: for they be many that fight against me, O thou most High.
All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.
As for the head of those that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
Mine enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are mad against me are sworn against me.

verses.text: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their musick.
Render unto them a recompence, O Lord, according to the work of their hands.

similars.text: Give them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their endeavours: give them after the work of their hands; render to them their desert.
For many nations and great kings shall serve themselves of them also: and I will recompense them according to their deeds, and according to the works of their own hands.

And by your hands I will work a marvelous work among the children of men, unto the convincing of many of their sins, that they may come unto repentance, and that they may come unto the kingdom of my Father.
O hear, O hear, O hear us, O Lord! And answer these petitions, and accept the dedication of this house unto thee, the work of our hands, which we have built unto thy name;
Then said they unto him, What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?
Unto the day when the Lord shall come to recompense unto every man according to his work, and measure to every man according to the measure which he has measured to his fellow man.
The Lord recompense thy work, and a full reward be given thee of the Lord God of Israel, under whose wings thou art come to trust.
Let thy work appear unto thy servants, and thy glory unto their children.
And let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us: and establish thou the work of our hands upon us; yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.

And let them deliver it into the hand of the doers of the work, that have the oversight of the house of the Lord: and let them give it to the doers of the work which is in the house of the Lord, to repair the breaches of the house,
Give them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their endeavours: give them after the work of their hands; render to them their desert.

verses.text: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.

similars.text: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.
To turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the children to the fathers, lest the whole earth be smitten with a curse--

If ye will not hear, and if ye will not lay it to heart, to give glory unto my name, saith the Lord of hosts, I will even send a curse upon you, and I will curse your blessings: yea, I have cursed them already, because ye do not lay it to heart.
And he shall turn the heart of the fathers to the children, and the heart of the children to their fathers, lest I come and smite the earth with a curse.
And he shall turn the heart of the fathers to the children, and the heart of the children to their fathers, lest I come and smite the earth with a curse.
Let all their wickedness come before thee; and do unto them, as thou hast done unto me for all my transgressions: for my sighs are many, and my heart is faint.
Thus saith the Lord; Cursed be the man that trusteth in man, and maketh flesh his arm, and whose heart departeth from the Lord.
But Alma said unto him: If this curse should be taken from thee thou wouldst again lead away the hearts of this people; therefore, it shall be unto thee even as the Lord will.
Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you.
For the Lord will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.
Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.
And now thou shalt be cursed from the earth which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand.
But behold I say unto you, love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them who despitefully use you and persecute you;
For such as be blessed of him shall inherit the earth; and they that be cursed of him shall be cut off.

My heart hath been weighed down with sorrow from time to time, for I have feared, lest for the hardness of your hearts the Lord your God should come out in the fulness of his wrath upon you, that ye be cut off and destroyed forever;
And they sorrowed in their hearts, for they durst not speak unto him the thing which they desired.
Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.
Behold, my servants shall sing for joy of heart, but ye shall cry for sorrow of heart, and shall howl for vexation of spirit.
Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God, if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.
And now art thou cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand;
Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.
For Satan putteth it into their hearts to anger against you, and to the shedding of blood.
Cursed be he that lieth with any manner of beast. And all the people shall say, Amen.
And again: I will set a mark upon him that mingleth his seed with thy brethren, that they may be cursed also.

verses.text: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the Lord.

similars.text: (For the Lord thy God is a jealous God among you) lest the anger of the Lord thy God be kindled against thee, and destroy thee from off the face of the earth.
But thus shall ye deal with them; ye shall destroy their altars, and break down their images, and cut down their groves, and burn their graven images with fire.

Understand therefore this day, that the Lord thy God is he which goeth over before thee; as a consuming fire he shall destroy them, and he shall bring them down before thy face: so shalt thou drive them out, and destroy them quickly, as the Lord hath said unto thee.
And ye shall overthrow their altars, and break their pillars, and burn their groves with fire; and ye shall hew down the graven images of their gods, and destroy the names of them out of that place.
But the Lord thy God shall deliver them unto thee, and shall destroy them with a mighty destruction, until they be destroyed.
Now, O Lord, because of this their humility wilt thou turn away thine anger, and let thine anger be appeased in the destruction of those wicked men whom thou hast already destroyed.
For the indignation of the Lord is kindled against their abominations and all their wicked works.
Go up against the land of Merathaim, even against it, and against the inhabitants of Pekod: waste and utterly destroy after them, saith the Lord, and do according to all that I have commanded thee.
Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.
Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the Lord will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.
And in that place they shall lift up their voices unto God against that people, yea, unto him whose anger is kindled against their wickedness, a people who are well-nigh ripened for destruction.
Shall they escape by iniquity? in thine anger cast down the people, O God.
And he shall deliver their kings into thine hand, and thou shalt destroy their name from under heaven: there shall no man be able to stand before thee, until thou have destroyed them.
Thus God executeth vengeance upon those that destroy his people. O God, receive my soul.
These are they who suffer the wrath of God on earth.
And the Lord thy God will put all these curses upon thine enemies, and on them that hate thee, which persecuted thee.
Ye are laying plans to pervert the ways of the righteous, and to bring down the wrath of God upon your heads, even to the utter destruction of this people.
Behold, the day of the Lord cometh, cruel both with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the land desolate: and he shall destroy the sinners thereof out of it.
Behold, the day of the Lord cometh, cruel both with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the land desolate; and he shall destroy the sinners thereof out of it.
Now will I shortly pour out my fury upon thee, and accomplish mine anger upon thee: and I will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense thee for all thine abominations.
Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.
For the indignation of the Lord is upon all nations, and his fury upon all their armies: he hath utterly destroyed them, he hath delivered them to the slaughter.
God is jealous, and the Lord revengeth; the Lord revengeth, and is furious; the Lord will take vengeance on his adversaries, and he reserveth wrath for his enemies.
Turn us, O God of our salvation, and cause thine anger toward us to cease.
And the Lord shall do unto them as he did to Sihon and to Og, kings of the Amorites, and unto the land of them, whom he destroyed.
But thou shalt utterly destroy them; namely, the Hittites, and the Amorites, the Canaanites, and the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites; as the Lord thy God hath commanded thee:

I will bring forth out of darkness unto light all their secret works and their abominations; and except they repent I will destroy them from off the face of the earth; and I will bring to light all their secrets and abominations, unto every nation that shall hereafter possess the land.

And they shall be visited with thunderings, and lightnings, and earthquakes, and all manner of destructions, for the fire of the anger of the Lord shall be kindled against them, and they shall be as stubble, and the day that cometh shall consume them, saith the Lord of Hosts.

The adversaries of the Lord shall be broken to pieces; out of heaven shall he thunder upon them: the Lord shall judge the ends of the earth; and he shall give strength unto his king, and exalt the horn of his anointed.
Howl ye, for the day of the Lord is at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.
Howl ye; for the day of the Lord is at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.
Let me alone, that I may destroy them, and blot out their name from under heaven: and I will make of thee a nation mightier and greater than they.
For they will turn away thy son from following me, that they may serve other gods: so will the anger of the Lord be kindled against you, and destroy thee suddenly.
These are they who suffer the vengeance of eternal fire.
For we will destroy this place, because the cry of them is waxen great before the face of the Lord; and the Lord hath sent us to destroy it.
Yea, cry unto him against the power of your enemies.
Yea, cry unto him against the devil, who is an enemy to all righteousness.

These are they who are cast down to hell and suffer the wrath of Almighty God, until the fulness of times, when Christ shall have subdued all enemies under his feet, and shall have perfected his work;
Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.
Thus saith the Lord God; Let it suffice you, O princes of Israel: remove violence and spoil, and execute judgment and justice, take away your exactions from my people, saith the Lord God.
Who shall be punished with everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord, and from the glory of his power;
Also in Horeb ye provoked the Lord to wrath, so that the Lord was angry with you to have destroyed you.
Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the Lord shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.

Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, mine anger and my fury shall be poured out upon this place, upon man, and upon beast, and upon the trees of the field, and upon the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall not be quenched.
Therefore, I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the Lord of Hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.
Therefore I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the Lord of hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.
Thus saith the Lord God; Because the Philistines have dealt by revenge, and have taken vengeance with a despiteful heart, to destroy it for the old hatred;
To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and punishments upon the people;
Cursed be their anger, for it was fierce; and their wrath, for it was cruel: I will divide them in Jacob, and scatter them in Israel.
For all that do these things are an abomination unto the Lord: and because of these abominations the Lord thy God doth drive them out from before thee.

And they that kill the prophets, and the saints, the depths of the earth shall swallow them up, saith the Lord of Hosts; and mountains shall cover them, and whirlwinds shall carry them away, and buildings shall fall upon them and crush them to pieces and grind them to powder.
And the anger of the Lord is kindled, and his sword is bathed in heaven, and it shall fall upon the inhabitants of the earth.

I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto ye go over Jordan to possess it; ye shall not prolong your days upon it, but shall utterly be destroyed.
How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger.

When ye have transgressed the covenant of the Lord your God, which he commanded you, and have gone and served other gods, and bowed yourselves to them; then shall the anger of the Lord be kindled against you, and ye shall perish quickly from off the good land which he hath given unto you.

Then my anger shall be kindled against them in that day, and I will forsake them, and I will hide my face from them, and they shall be devoured, and many evils and troubles shall befall them; so that they will say in that day, Are not these evils come upon us, because our God is not among us?
Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the Lord persecute them.
Hear, O our God; for we are despised: and turn their reproach upon their own head, and give them for a prey in the land of captivity:
